description: The man accused of killing 24-year-old Taylor Bins in DeKalb County is asking for bond.
title: Man wants bond after allegedly killing woman over a watch in DeKalb
title_page: Man wants bond after allegedly killing woman over a watch in DeKalb
text:
The man accused of killing 24-year-old Taylor Bins in DeKalb County is asking for bond.
Jason Leroy Brown, 34, who is accused of murder for allegedly killing her during a fight over a watch, is set to appear in court at the county courthouse Friday at 9 a.m
The woman died July 26 around 7 or 8 a.m. on Hitt Lake Trail off Rockbridge Road outside Stone Mountain. Warrants say witnesses told police the suspect came looking for the victim about a watch.
READ: Brother: Atlanta family saw miraculous sights in New Mexico desert
READ: Fake ‘City of Atlanta’ Facebook page back after Stone Mountain prank
READ:2 young people accused in death of DeKalb man stabbed 33 times
While arguing with her about it, he began to beat her and dragged her down the stairs and into the street, the warrants allege. Along the way, it appeared Bins had a seizure and died.
The suspect’s relationship to the victim hasn’t been released, but warrants call the case one of family violence. Brown is said to have left the scene but was booked into jail days later on a murder charge.
